s.text: Georgia's economy has recovered faster than other former republics due to its tourist trade (the Black Sea Coast has a warm climate) and its relative political stability.

Ethnic Chechens--descendants of an isolated mountain people--were strong trade partners with Russia in the 18 th and 19 th centuries, but rebelled violently against annexation in the late 1700s and again in the 1840s and 1850s.

The fight over Nagorno-Karabakh (and resulting ethnic violence) has left Azerbaijan divided: Virtually no ethnic Azerbaijanis live in the disputed territory, and virtually none of Azerbaijan's ethnic Armenians live outside it.

Ethnic Chechens--descendants of an isolated mountain people--were strong trade partners with Russia in the 18 th and 19 th centuries, but rebelled violently against annexation in the late 1700s and again in the 1840s and 1850s.
At least 40,000 people were killed in the ensuing war and 300,000 fled.
Armenian and Russian immigrants prevented Azerbaijanis from reaping the full benefits of their oil industry.
Russia gained control of the largely Muslim nation in 1859.
Armenian and Russian immigrants prevented Azerbaijanis from reaping the full benefits of their oil industry.
